analytic.title: The Newly Discovered Paintings in the Dome over the Sanctuary in Deir al-Surian

biblStruct.note: The church of the Holy Virgin in the Coptic monastery Deir al-Surian was constructed in the middle of the seventh century and its sanctuary was refurbished in the early tenth century under abbot Moses of Nisibis. The paintings in the dome over the altar from that time were covered by plaster in the eightheenth century and came back to light again in 2017.

body.bibl: Innemée, Karel C. “The Newly Discovered Paintings in the Dome over the Sanctuary in Deir Al-Surian.” Byzantinische Zeitschrift 116:1 (2023): 53–76. https://doi.org/https://doi.org/10.1515/bz-2023-0003.
Karel C. Innemée, The Newly Discovered Paintings in the Dome over the Sanctuary in Deir Al-Surian, Byzantinische Zeitschrift 116:1 (2023): 53–76, https://doi.org/https://doi.org/10.1515/bz-2023-0003.
